title-group.article-title: An Application of Options to Foreign Exchange Rate Forecasting

abstract.p: This paper proposes and tests a model of foreign exchange rate forecasting based on the relationships explained by interest rate parity theorem and the put-call parity for European options on foreign currency. The model forecasts the future spot rate by combining the value of the option with that of the forward rate. Its structure is simple, as it requires only a few inputs easily obtainable in the marketplace. The empirical results indicate that the proposed model produces more accurate forecasts of future spot rates than those obtained from both the forward model and a martingale model.
